New Records: Harry Brook scored his first ODI century and led England to a 46-run win using the DLS method
Key Match Events: Heavy rain caused the match to be decided by the DLS method
Mitchell Starc dismissed Phil Salt and Ben Duckett in the same over
Will Jacks and Phil Salt scored significant contributions with 84 and 63 respectively
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Harry Brook emphasized the importance of momentum from previous matches
Australia had a depleted squad with Travis Head and Adam Zampa resting
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Brook expressed relief at his performance and leadership
Mitchell Marsh acknowledged England's strong performance and Australia's struggles
Miscellaneous Highlights: England maintained their recent winning streak at Lord's
The match was a turning point in the series with Australia losing their 14-match ODI winning streak
Others: The match was the penultimate game of the series, setting up the final ODI on September 29
